3: Watanabe-San! The remaining Corrupted have been disposed of!
Watanabe gives a nod and looks at the Akdilek entourage. Smiling, Jamilah waves back at him.
Sophia stays at her side. She didn't seem to have moved at all. With not a single Corrupted form next to her, the Forsaken seem to have won the bout.
What is the meaning of this, Akdilek?
It's nothing. The boss merely told us not to engage.
Then according to our agreement, all three containers now belong to the Forsaken!
All aboard the ship let out a joyful cry, as if this was the climax to the performance they had been waiting for.
Wait, three containers? We had a deal for just one.
Miss Pulao specifically said 'all of the cargo', did she not? You all heard it. Or do the Forsaken habitually forsake their agreements?
This ain't good, Watanabe-San. We still taking the cargo? We can't transport so much!
Watanabe closes his eyes with a sigh. Jamilah and her band of jackals noticed this in advance. That's why they let the cargo go uncontested.
Sophia, it seems our Forsaken friends have run into a logistical pickle. Seeing as we are all comrades abandoned on this Earth, shouldn't the Akdeliks lend them a hand?
The Akdilek Commercial Alliance has fleets of medium to heavy transport vehicles, capable of safely handling long-haul logistics across any terrain, at a reasonable price.
Hmph, this was all part of your plan, wasn't it... Forget it. Let this be a lesson for us.
Huh? What's that mean, Watanabe-San?
Sigh... we wish to engage the Akdileks' transportation service. When can you depart?
Thank you for your patronage. We are ready to depart whenever you're ready... Changyu, you will lead the convoy and escort the cargo.
The silent, gawking black-haired adolescent jumps at the mention of his name, bewildered.
Me? Wait, why me?
Sophia and I have trading partners to seek out here, and you'll be of no use in that.
Hey, is this kid really up to the task?
Of course. He is a force to be reckoned with among the Akdileks. Best not to underestimate him.
Huh, just as well, I want off this boat anyway.
So, Changyu, would you please escort the Forsaken to their cargo?
As Jamilah waves goodbye to Changyu's group, Sophia finally asks the question that's been on her mind.
Boss, why did you specifically ask Changyu to escort them?
Jamilah gazes at the departing Watanabe, accompanied by Changyu, and a smile creeps onto her face.
Maybe... I just felt like it.
...so, can I trust you with this?
You should find it hard to refuse, what with us being good acquaintances and all.
I kid... but I feel that the members of your team, that kid included, could use a little trip to get used to your new changes.
I think that it is an excellent suggestion. Don't you?
Hoho, I think you'll thank me for it—Commandant.
